intro: Sauroglossum organense, commonly known as the Organ Mountains daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Its botanical structure reflects its evolutionary response to the extreme conditions of its native habitat.
